captions.text: (easy-going music)
- Crap it hard.
It has been a while,
since I frickin' told you a story.
Last year I moved to a neighborhood,
a very compact neighborhood.
In fact it's so compact that
we get great gas mileage
out of the neighborhood (laughs).
It's pretty compact, yeah.
I mean I can pick up all the unobtainable,

flamboyantly named wireless
routers, they're all there.
You know, and they're all blocked
by encryption keys and passwords,
and there's like two down the street

that I can't get to that
just happen to be unlocked.
And there's one wireless printer,
look, right here, I can get to it.
Well you can't see, but look.
Who are you?

I have actually heard
of people doing pranks
on wireless printers for years now.
It's no secret.
They're all out there.
I actually had a friend who mooned someone
through a wireless printer (laughs).
Strength!
I didn't care at the time, you know,

wow, it's a printer, I
have a printer, an Epson.

It's a great printer,
so why should I care?
Why should I even partake in any
precarious activities such as that?
I shouldn't.
I darn right shouldn't.
Until a friend visited me, a great friend,
been friends since the beginning.
Bor-e-d...
- om, boredom.

It's hustled me into
quite a bit of mischief.
Quite a bit.
A lot, crapload, tons.

The only way to liberate
yourself out of boredom
is to give in and drop the chief.
You can't have mischief without chief.
Drop the chief.
So it had been like six months
since I first discovered the printer.
So I decided, you know, I'm bored,
let me check to see if it's still there.
I did just that.
It was there.
Why not print something?
I mean I'm here, the printer's out there.
One plus one equals fun.
I brewed over this forever.
Seconds passed and I finally
figured out what I wanted to do.
Moon someone.
My friend did it, why can't I do it?
There's no rule out there that says that.
Right?!?

From the moment I was born I
was mooning people for sport.
The doctor that delivered me,

his eyes were stained
with my mini cinibuns.
I have given the drive-through
the pale behind, rewind (laughs).
That's so friggin' stupid!
It doesn't even make any sense.

I once mooned five miles
of highway traffic,
and I was driving.
Kidding.
It was eight miles.

I actually had a staring
match with the moon,
moon to moon, and I won.

I actually think I might
have affected the tides.

I had never mooned someone
through a wireless printer.
I mean this could be an achievement.
Three hours later I let it shine.
I hit print.
Why did it take so long?
Well see, I had concerns,
since there was no getting away from this.
Whoever acquired thine chunky cheeks
would have that evidence forever.
Forbid this goes to the cops,

and I have learned from
years of dropping the chief
that you cover your tracks.
So I decided to use a disguise.
That's what took three hours, all right?
Let me tell you what.
I felt alive!
It was like air had new meaning.
It was like a super air.

It's exactly like air, but
with none of the calories.
It was amazing!
Who's eyes are tainted with my butt?
I don't know (laughs).
Who's eyes are tainted with my butt?
I have no idea.
But it was done,
and I was back to being super-bored.

Until that night when a
person came to my door.
I remember saying to myself,
"I'm not going to open this door,"

but that nefarious
curiosity (exhales loudly).
I opened the door, OK?
I needed to know if this was him.
So I opened the door, and immediately
he starts spraying out sentences at me.
"Hey, I'm your next door neighbor,
"I've come by because...

"Somebody printed something
out of my printer,

"and I wanted to see if
it might have been you."
I wasn't gonna tell him, "Yes."
I was tactfully evade, you know?
"Mine?
"I have my own printer.
"It's an Epson, it's right upstairs."

"Do you have any idea who
might have done this?"
"It doesn't really seem like a big deal.
"You know, it's probably just a mix up.
"What is that, what's the picture?

"Maybe you could identify
him by the picture."
"It's a butt."
"Excuse me, what?"
"A butt."
"Eww!
"Who would do such acts like this?
"And they're in our neighborhood?"
He then flips the picture around, right?
And he shows me.
I mean it was strangely beguiling,

until I realized that I had
inadvertently mooned myself.
"How can somebody print one of these out?"
"Well, we have a wireless printer,
"and it wasn't just one.
"It was every sheet of paper we had."
Mischief managed.
"Did they leave any clues?"
"No clues."
"I mean it's hard to see any clues

"with the, what is that,
a mustache and a hat?"
The chief has landed.

I spirit-gummed a mustache
on my honey-baked,
so no-one could identify my hams.
Come to think about it I could probably
of just Photoshopped it on,

which it would've been a lot
less painful ripping it off.
I also taped a hat, a little cowboy hat
that I got from Build-a-Bear
on my left butt cheek.
I though it was hilarious.
I would love to show you this picture,
if it was on my computer anymore.
I deleted it to cover my tracks.
I will go the less preferred route,

and I will draw you a picture
of what it looked like.

This is what dropping
the chief looks like.

The guy then thanked me for
my time and walked away.
And I could tell he was mad.

He was so mad, and I kind
of watched him for a bit,

as he was walking away, and
I realized that he was going
to the next house cause he really
wanted to find out who this was.
So the entire time I was watching him,

he pretty much went through
the entire neighborhood.
And then it hit me.
I just mooned the entire neighborhood!
(laughs hysterically)
Every now and then I moon 'em, you know,
just because (laughs).
But you know, you gotta let them know

when the sun goes down,
there's gonna be a moon.
(easy-going music)
